content.text: Most arguments you'll encounter are in English. Work them out in a **dual manner**: First use intuition - does it seem valid? Then translate and apply the star test. If they agree, great! If they disagree, recheck your work.
When translating, use the **same letter for the same idea** and **different letters for different ideas**. The same idea may be phrased differently throughout an argument.

content.definition: Singular terms (specific individuals) → lowercase letters. General terms (categories) → CAPITAL letters. This distinction can affect validity!

content.title: Invalid - Using General Term
premises: Al is a man. → a is M
My father is a man. → f is M
content.conclusion: ∴ Al is my father. → ∴ a* is f*
content.note: INVALID! M (man) is a category that includes many people. Al and my father could both be men without being the same person.

content.title: Valid - Using Singular Term
premises: Al is the NY mayor. → a is m
My father is the NY mayor. → f is m
content.conclusion: ∴ Al is my father. → ∴ a* is f*
content.note: VALID! Here 'm' is a specific individual (the unique NY mayor). If both Al and my father are that same person, they must be identical.

content.text: **Translation Tips:** If you have trouble tracking letters, underline phrases in the English argument and write the corresponding letter above. This prevents confusion about which phrase corresponds to which letter.

content.title: A Famous Philosophical Argument
premises: All segregation laws degrade human personality. → all S is D
All laws that degrade human personality are unjust. → all D is U
content.conclusion: ∴ All segregation laws are unjust. → ∴ all S is U
content.note: This valid argument is from Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. The star test: S*-D, D-U, S-U* = each capital once, one right star. VALID!

symbols.name: Universal
symbols.example: All dogs are mammals → all D is M

symbols.name: Universal Negative
symbols.example: No reptiles are mammals → no R is M

symbols.name: Particular
symbols.example: Some birds fly → some B is F

symbols.name: Singular Negative
symbols.example: Socrates isn't immortal → s is not I

content.question: 'The president' should be translated as:
options: A capital letter P (it's a category)
A lowercase letter p (it's a specific person)
content.explanation: 'The president' refers to a specific individual (whoever holds that unique position), so use lowercase 'p'. A category would be 'presidents' (any person who has been president).
